Estrella requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like chicken, pork, liver, etc. for her food vending business. She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken, pork, liver, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe works hard to support her family. Febe is married and has an internet cafe business in the Philippines.

Febe has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to pay for internet bills, electricity and to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers.

Febe has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Febe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for internet bills, electricity and to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers.

loans.name: Eutequia

texts.en:
Eutequia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Eutequia requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like shells, wires, cutter, etc., for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Eutequia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like shells, wires, cutter, etc., for her business

loans.name: Jose Jorge

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia integrada por su esposa y dos niñas, es empleado y su esposa le ayuda a entender el negocio en el que ofrece variedad de ropa,cosméticos y variedad de accesorios de uso personal, nació a raíz de la necesidad de  generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Invertirá en la compra de cremas, lociones, vestidos, blusas, faldas, pantalones, etc., con lo que fortalecerá sus negocio, espera aumentar su clientela, tener mejores ventas, y lograr una economía más estable que le dé la facilidad de cancelar sus deudas.
Aspira tener un negocio más competitivo, rentable, y dar una vida llena de oportunidades para su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two daughters. His wife helps him run a store where they sell a variety of goods: clothing, cosmetics, and personal accessories. José and his wife started the business because they needed income to cover their family's expenses. 

José will invest the loan funds in the purchase of creams; lotions; and clothing, such as blouses, skirts, pants, and other items. This additional inventory will strengthen the business, and José is hopeful that it will bring more customers to his shop. The resulting higher sales will stabilize his family's finances and make it easier for him to pay his debts. 

José is striving to have a more competitive, profitable business and provide his family a life full of opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase creams; lotions; and clothing, such as blouses, skirts, pants, and other items.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg, who is 24 years old, lives in Akhalkalaki city with his parents. His mother is a housekeeper and his father is an artisan and has private construction orders. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of his family. Sadly, for lack of economic resources, Gevorg was unable to study a professional career. As a result, he is unemployed nowadays and has a great desire to start his own business and help his family to increase their living condition. 
He received the loan credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The initiative is called Start-up Program and it gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of 3,500 Georgian Lari, he will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and sell them.  He has already made a counter to display the produce, as is shown in the picture. He plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced products.
Gevorg is very grateful to Kiva lenders.  With their support, he will be able to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables so that his business will be better-stocked and he can take care of more customers and continue working and striving to reach his desires.

loans.use: to start a stand selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 30 years old, a mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very hardworking and responsible housewife who always helps her husband in the running of their grocery shop. 

For many years, her husband has been running a grocery shop which is the only source of income for his family. Currently he needs to purchase inventory for next year to continue his shop, but due to financial constraints he finds it difficult. For that reason, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help her husband to grow his shop but will increase his net income and savings as well. 

Samina's desire is to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for their general store.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is 35, a responsible mother of two children. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has some cattle at home and produces milk which he sells in his locality. He has been keeping this herd at home; through breeding he has been increasing his cattle for many years. He wants to increase the milk production and wants to buy an additional cow so that he could grow the herd. However, due to lack of capital he is unable to buy a cow.

Therefore, Kubra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy an additional cow with the contribution of cash in hand. He hopes that now he can easily carry on his business and progress. 

Kubra thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow and have more milk to sell.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en: Augustin is 51 years old. He is married to a businesswoman with whom he has six children. With the loan, he would like to buy more livestock for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more livestock, especailly cows for sale.

loans.name: Benvenida

texts.en:
Benvenida is a married woman from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol and she is the mother of 3 children. She operates a Jeepney and provides vehicle transport services.  Aside from operating a transportation service, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of supplies like beverages, sugar, soap, canned goods, and toiletries.

In the future, Benvenida hopes to expand both of her businesses and to increase business profitability to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock of supplies like beverages, sugar, soap, canned goods, and toiletries.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is a 51-year-old woman from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She is married with five children. She runs a T-shirt printing business. Her business started six years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy materials for shirt printing such as paint, frames and screens, etc., to provide her customers with the best quality output.

In the future, Calixta hopes to expand her T-shirt printing business and increase business profitability for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy materials for shirt printing such as paint,  frames and screens, etc

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is single without children. He is 42 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Philippines.
Raul  sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to restock his store with basic commodities.
Raul has been a member of PMPC for 9 months.  In the future, Raul hope to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 44 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Jean works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan to restock her stall with additional fish.
Jean has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, she hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her stall with additional fish.

loans.name: Willo

texts.en:
Willo is married with two children. He is 52-years-old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Willo is a farmer and grows rice and corn crops in order to earn a living. He has been doing this for ten years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional pesticides and insecticides.

Willo has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for five years. In the future, Willo hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is married with three children. Sergio is 62-years-old and lives in Libertad Alto, Philippines.

Sergio is a farmer and grows coconut crops in order to earn a living. He has been doing this for 25 years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers.

Sergio has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for four years. In the future, Sergio hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Nelpa

texts.en:
Nelpa is married with two children. She is 54 years old and lives in Masabud, Clarin, Philippines.

Nelpa is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

Nelpa has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Nelpa hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 53 years old and married with seven children. With one child still in school, Felisa works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, candies, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc. 

Felisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is married with three children. He is 54-years-old and lives in Masabud, Clarin, Philippines.

Leonardo  is a farmer and grows coconut crops in order to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. He has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

Leonardo has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for a month. In the future, Leonardo hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Georgi

texts.en:
From a rented garage in Masis town, Georgi provides high quality service to his customers who value the work that he does.

Georgi is the father of a daughter. He lives with his wife, retired mother and 30-year-old daughter. His wife is a musician and works at a local musical school. Georgi works hard to gather a good income and cover the family's basic needs. 

Now, by asking for this loan, Georgi would like to ask for financial support to purchase tools and equipment needed for his work. Georgi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This loan is very important for Georgi to continue providing his service with better tools and equipment and provide better service to his clients.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing auto repair service

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya is 32 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of three children.

Suraiya's husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Suraiya has applied for a loan. She will use the loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.

Suraiya is hoping that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: for maintenance of auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Beglar

texts.en:
Beglar is a 48-year-old married man who lives in Marneuli district. He has a wife, two sons and a daughter. His daughter gets a disability pension of 100 GEL from the local government, and his sons are learning at the university. Beglar's wife works at a school canteen and generates 500 GEL monthly. Beglar is unemployed at the moment. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, especially among people up to 40. 
 
As the existing income is not enough for their five-member family and Beglar can’t find any other job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Beglar applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of 2,500 USD will help him to purchase a secondhand car. Beglar will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them around the city. He is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person. He has a great desire to provide his children with a good education for progressing in life and to provide significant help for his disabled daughter. This credit will be a great support for the family. Beglar is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a car to start a taxi business

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería y pulpería, vende productos como manteca, arroz, sal, productos enlatados, productos de aseo, harina, etc. También vende blusas, camisas, ropa interior y otros. Este negocio lo tiene hace 3 años y vende en su casa. Anteriormente trabajaba en un centro de cuidados de niños. Esta solicitando el séptimo ciclo que es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar productos como granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, productos enlatados etc. también perfumes y zapatos para surtir y vender en esta temporada. Tiene como meta tener un negocio más grande para darles educación y salud a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sara is 37 years old and is married. She has 3 children and lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. She sells merchandise and groceries, products like butter, rice, salt, canned goods, toiletries, flour, etc. She also sells blouses, shirts, and underwear, among others. She has had this business for 3 years and runs it in her home. Before, she worked in a child-care center.

She is in the 7th loan cycle and is asking for 15,000 lempiras which she will use to buy products like staple grains, sugar, butter, canned goods, etc., and also perfumes and shoes to stock and sell in this season. 

Her goal is to have a bigger business in order to provide education and health to her children.

loans.use: to buy products like staple grains, sugar, butter, canned goods, etc., also perfumes, and shoes.

loans.name: Thuy Group

texts.en:
Thuy is 32 years old. She is the mother of two children: her daughter is in the 4th grade and her son is 4 years old.

Thuy and her husband sell bananas to earn a living. The monthly income of Thuy’s family is 6,000,000 VND per month. The major difficulty that Thuy is facing is a lack of capital to develop her business. Thus, she would love to borrow 10,528,000 VND to purchase more bananas to resell. With the profit from her business, Thuy expects that she would have the chance to improve her family's living condition and raise up her children well. Besides, Thuy hopes that she can raise more poultry and cattle to gain more income.

Thuy joined SEDA’s program in 2009 and she has successfully repaid 6 loans. She is the leader of a group which consists of 4 members. The names of the members who are part of Thuy groups are listed below:

• Anh is 55 years old. She is a farmer and the mother of 3 children. She is requesting a loan of 6,944,000 VND to feed hens.
• Luyen is 44 years old. She is an experienced farmer and the mother of 4 children. She would love to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise chickens.
• Tuyet is 31 years old. She has 3 children. She is a businesswoman. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to invest in her fruit shop.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to resell

loans.name: İslam

texts.en: İslam is a 30-year-old man, married for eight years with a child. He lives with his family in the Abseron region. His wife is a nurse at a dentist. Nine years ago, his uncle helped Islam to buy a car, and since that time he has been in the taxi driver business. He transports passengers between the Abseron and Fuzuli regions. Today Islam needs a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy winter wheels for his car. İslam says he is thankful to the Kiva organization for helping. He wants to give a good education to his child in the future.

loans.use: to buy winter wheels for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy veterinary compounds, seeds and feeds

loans.name: Erlen

texts.en:
Erlen is married and lives in Palayan, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is happy with her family and has two beautiful and handsome children who are in primary level.
   
She has a junk shop that serves as their family business and gives them income that compensates their basic needs and necessities.  Moreover, she has been a member of PMPC for a good number of years. Through this, she asks for financial assistance to finance the purchase of recycled materials to sell to gain more costumers. It is a great help for her and to her family to have progress in her business.

loans.use: to finance the purchase of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en: Dilshod is 38 years, married, and she has two children. She is a hardworking woman.  She is a careful mother and always tries to provide her children with all necessary things. Dilshod’s husband is a farmer. He has a small income, and his income is not enough to provide a living. Dilshod decided to organize her own business because she needs the money. She lives in an agricultural region and that’s why she has a good opportunity to develop an animal husbandry business. Dilshod is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy cattle to develop her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to develop her new business.

loans.name: Avito

texts.en:
Avito is a 39-year-old man from the town of Panglao, Bohol. He is married with 3 school-age children. He engages in selling seafood and fresh fish to the community. His business started quite a few years ago.

He is asking for a loan to buy more seafood products and fish to sell to improve his income.

In the future, Avito would like to expand his business and increase business profitability for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more seafood products and fish to sell

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is married with 6 children.  She is 64 years old and lives in Tipan, Sinacaban, Philippines.
Alfreda is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy 2 sacks of fertilizers.
Alfreda has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Alfreda hopes to expand her corn plantation.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is divorced with 1 child. She is 60 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban, Philippines.
Benedicta  is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional feed for her pigs.
Benedicta has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle for her vehicle transport business. Felixberta has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Felixberta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is married with 2 children. She is 47 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.
Eden sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippine pesos doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to restock her store with basic commodities.
Eden has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Eden hope to support her children's education.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Mulyadi

texts.en: Since Mulyadi took a loan from Kiva, he has been able to serve more transactions in selling mobile phone airtime credits. The loan allowed him to generate more sales. Mulyadi still sees an opportunity to grasp; he needs your support in acquiring more working capital from a loan.

loans.use: To obtain more float to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is a married woman with four children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Flordelisa is 40 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Flordelisa has a handicraft business in the Philippines.  Flordelisa requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, scissors, wire, etc. for her business.

Flordelisa has been in this business for 12 years.  In the future, Flordelisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, scissors, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca works hard to support her family. Francisca is married, and has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in The Philippines.

Francisca requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Francisca has been in this business for six years now.

Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Susey Deyanira

texts.es: Susey es originaria de la ciudad de León, de 22 años de edad. Una joven soltera sin hijos a cargo. Ella con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante para ser una persona profesional y exitosa. Sus papas la apoyan en todo. Su sueño es poder culminar sus estudios y obtener su título. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación, con el fin de cumplir con sus metas en la vida y poder de cierta manera ayudarle económicamente a sus padres. Su plan es tener un empleo y seguir adelante para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Susey is from the city of León and is 22 years old. She is a young single woman with no dependent children. With great effort she has managed to get ahead to be a professional and successful person. Her parents support her in everything. It is her dream to finish her studies and get her degree.

She is asking for a loan to pay for the degree course in order to fulfill her goals in life and to be able to support her parents economically. It is her plan to find a job and to get further ahead to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 58 years old, married, and from the village of Rodinauli.  She lives with her grown son and husband.  Her family runs an agricultural business and breeds three milk cows.  Lali produces cheese to sell with the milk they produce.  Moreover, Lali and her family grow grapes on their own vineyard and sell the harvest locally.

Lali is a very hardworking woman and wishes to provide her family with the enough income.  That’s why she decided to start a trading business.  With this start-up loan, Lali plans to purchase a van and have her son use it for making fruit and vegetable deliveries.  They will sell the fresh produce in the neighboring villages and have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future. 

With the support of the Start-Up program, Lali will have an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle their financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a van to make fruit & vegetable deliveries

loans.name: Sreyhen

texts.en:
Sreyhen is 36 years old and a married mother, blessed with two dependent kids and resides in Kampong Cham province. 

The main sources of her family income are from rice cropping and their business as house builders.  Her business has generated her about 35,600 KHR per day.  

New to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is seeking for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy construction materials, including a tile cutter, to support her house building business. She hopes that this purchase will help speed up their work and return a good profit.

loans.use: To buying construction materials, such as a tile cutter, to support her house building business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Faneena

texts.en:
Faneena is a 33-year-old poor lady. Her husband has been changing his profession from time-to-time for many years. A few months ago he was doing a job as a laborer in a firm on very low wages. Now he decided to drive a rickshaw again. He already has an auto rickshaw of his own but he was not driving it due to its damaged body.

Therefore, Fareena is taking a loan to encourage her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and drive auto rickshaw again. Faneena hopes that her husband would be stable in this profession and drive auto rickshaw for a long time.

Faneena is very thankful to Kiva and to field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 48 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family; she is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her one son has got married and is living separately, so Nusrat is now living with her three children and spouse. To manage her household expenses she runs a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. Nusrat and her two daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her younger daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work with her and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Nusrat wants to buy a new Juki sewing machine for her so that she can contribute income by sewing clothes.

Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy new Juki sewing machine for her younger daughter. Nusrat wants to make some savings so that she can arrange the marriage ceremonies of her daughters. 

Nusrat thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new Juki sewing machine for her daughter's tailoring work.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is 28, a mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by trade, and he has sold fresh vegetables in his shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal, fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the  income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources of income to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables.

Therefore, Tahmina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more seasonal vegetables. Tahmina thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh, seasonal vegetables to sell in their shop.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is the age of 35, living in Lahore, with her husband and five children. 
Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years; he and his instruments have grown old which are needed to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments, but his financial condition does not allow him to buy them. 

Due to his low purchasing power, Rubina requested a loan to empower his purchasing power, and he can easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, front mirror, revolving chair, and additional hair colour.

Rubina hopes that this loan will work positively and she will be able to make some savings for household expenses. All members of this group will utilize the amount according to their needs. All members thank Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy instruments for the barber shop of her husband.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 37-year-old married woman.  She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband in a corner of her house.  She has four years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing the inventory of goods from the market, as he has made many contacts ove the years. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with increasing demand in her store. It’s her third year with BRAC Pakistan and she has shown good repayment behavior.  She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with increasing demand in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is age 33. She is the mother of two and she is married to a businessman. She sells various items in her boutique and has been in the business for the past five years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, cooking oil and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more salt, cooking oil and soaps for sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 49 years old. She is married with three children. She sells various items and has been in business for the last seven years. She sells foodstuffs and has spent seven years in that business. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, maize and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Pellumb

texts.en:
Pellumb is a 27-year-old single man who is getting married soon. He has been in the construction industry since he reached the age of 22. He is requesting a loan for the first time because he wants to finish the building of the house that you can see in the background. The main floor will be used for his business to store the materials and tools, and the floor above will be serving the family.

The village where Pellumb lives is very high and the road is very bad, uneven and bumpy. Not very many vehicles go there, except off-road vehicles or jeeps. The white vehicle parked adjacent to the house is the one that our organization uses to reach to those locations.

loans.use: to do some work at his newly built home that he will use for business as well

loans.name: Starehe Junction Group

texts.en:
Starehe Junction Group is a young group operating small-scale businesses in open air markets in Eastern Kenya. They travel around different markets with different household items, clothes, shoes and farm inputs. Their target market is households with low incomes who have to shop in open air markets where items are cheaper. The group is made up of 5 members who have been saving with VEP for the last 6 months and have a very credible reputation along with discipline. They have a vision of opening up a distribution stall where they can employ other youths to assist in sales around the local markets which open different days of the week. With this in mind, they would also like to include solar lamps into their stock as one of the products that can help those at the bottom of the pyramid without access to electricity.

Samuel, the group treasurer (on the far left), was the first one to buy a solar lamp from VEP during a roadshow to their region. After experiencing the changes in his fuel budget and the quality of light, he promoted the lamp to his friends in the market who agreed to form a group and get the lamps on credit for their homes. Samuel says since he bought the lamp, he has saved a lot of money previously used to buy kerosine and for mobile charging. His children also started enjoying longer study hours which has led to improved grades.  Samuel and the group would like to see other families enjoying clean, convenient lighting while at the same time they make money from the sale of those lamps.

They have purchased different types of solar lamps from VEP on credit and, with their sale, we are confident the group will repay the loan from the profits and even take a second loan to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase solar lanterns to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
Lina is a 30-year-old married woman from a small village near Tulkarem city. She lives with her husband and three kids; two sons and one daughter in a small house in the city. Lina's husband works as a farmer on the family land for four years. He plants seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them in the local market.
Lina took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy seeds and seedlings to improve his farm and expand it. By taking this loan, Lina and her husband will be able to improve their farm and increase productivity.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings to improve her farm and expand it.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and married with three children.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Grace has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Grace aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ohunjon

texts.en:
Ohunjon was born in 1992. He is a smart young man and always tries to learn more information. Ohunjon studied in school well and he entered after graduating school the Tajik Commerce University. Now he is a student of the third course. 

Ohunjon likes reading. He is not married and lives with his parents. He must pay for tuition but does not have the money. He is asking for a loan of 750 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gloria is 37 years old, and has two children who are still in school.

Gloria has a general store business in The Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Gloria has been in this business for four years. In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a father residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. He has two sons who are too young for schooling. For the sake of his kids, he does cassava and rice cropping as his main source of income. This business has returned him about 21,900 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Including this loan, Thy is in his third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has repaid his last loan completely, and it has enabled him to improve his living conditions, better than before. Now, he will spend a portion of  this loan to buy a plot of farmland to expand his crops, as well as to buy fertilizer for his cassava. He hopes that he can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland and fertilizer for his cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land to grow crops.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 42 years old. She is married with five children aged between five and eighteen. She has requested a loan to buy more retail items such as soaps, salts and drinks to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more salts, soaps and drinks to sell

loans.name: Dúo Jeshua Group

texts.es: Dúo Jeshua Doña Catalina atiende una pequeña venta de refacciones, jugos, golosinas etc.vende En las afueras de la escuela pública de nivel diversificado en la localidad de San Juan Sacatepéquez, atiende todos los días en dos tiempos de receso, gracias a esta oportunidad ella logra obtener un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo quien no tiene un trabajo estable y sus dos hijos están en la escuela, su hija mayor ingresa el tercer año de nivel primaria y el mas pequeño este año entra en el nivel de párvulos, ahora que ya iniciaron las clases quiere aprovechar y poder ofrecerles a los jóvenes todo lo necesario y no perder su clientela, por lo que solicita capital para lograr comprar, carnes, tostadas, golosinas, aguas, jugos etc.
texts.en:
The Jeshua Doña Duo

Catalina has a small store selling light refreshments, juices, sweets and more. She sells her goods outside the public school in San Juan Sacatepéquez. She works there every day at break times. Thanks to this work, Catalina has an income in order to help her husband - who does not have a stable job - and her children, who are in school. Catalina's eldest daughter will soon start third grade, while the youngest will start nursery school. As classes are just beginning, Catalina wants to take advantage and offer all necessary items and not lose any customers. To do this, Catalina is applying for a loan in order to buy meat, toasted bread, sweets, water, juices and more.

loans.use: to buy meat, toasted bread, sweets, water, juices and more.

loans.name: Spiro

texts.en: Spiro is back again; he wants to add inventory of materials to sell in his store.

loans.use: To stock up on construction materials for his hardware store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings to improve and expand his farm

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 28-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. Ibrahim has worked as a farmer on the family land for five years. He uses greenhouses to insure a good quality for the crops. He plants seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them in the local market.

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy the raw materials for building new greenhouses on his farm, and also to buy fertilizers. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to improve his farm and increase the productivity. 

Ibrahim appears in the photo on his farm.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials for building new greenhouses on his farm, and also to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Hosni

texts.en:
Hosni is 30 years old and he lives in Gaza with his wife and three children.

On the first of May 2012, Mahmoud opened his own barbershop. Recently he hired an employee to help him because his costumers are continuously increasing as he is very well known now.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a hairdryer and make new decorations for his barbershop. This will increase the number of clients and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and make new decorations for his barbershop

loans.name: Narcesa

texts.en:
Narcesa, 59, is a married woman from the town of Tagbilaran City, Bohol.  She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like biscuits, soap, coffee, cooking oil, sugar, noodles and canned goods to augment the income of her household. Her business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more canned goods, noodles, candies,beverages, toiletries, and other items to sell. 

In the future, Narcesa would like to expand her business and increase business profitability to develop a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, candies,beverages, toiletries, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina de 37 años de edad, no estudio ya que ella por la distancia no pudo ir a la escuela, debido que para poder estudiar tenia que trasladarse a otro lugar y no había transporte en aquella época.  Ella es casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, 2 hijos le ayudan a él al trabajo en la agricultura y también estudian por la tarde y el otro viajo hace 4 meses para estados unidos.

Ella se dedica al cuido de animales domésticos en su casa, ella posee gallinas y una mancuerna de cerdos. Aprendió este Trabajo ya que sus padres desde cuando estaba pequeña le enseñaron a hacer estos trabajos y de esta manera es como ella hoy en día se gana la vida y también sus hijos le ayudan a lo que es el cuido de estos animalitos.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar harinilla para darle a sus cerdos, así engordarlos y cuando los venda podrá obtener algunos ingresos que le serán de mucha utilidad, para hacer algunos gastos en su familia.

Ella desea engordar estos cerdos para sacarlos a la venta en diciembre, ya que de sus hijos que estudia se le va a graduar uno de noveno  y desea comprarle el uniforme y  y celebrarle su graduación, también desea seguir ayudandole para que continúe con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Reina is 37 years old. She did not go to school as it was very far away. She would have had to travel to another place and, at the time, there was no transport. Reina is married; her husband works in farming. Two of the couple's children help their father with his work and also study in the afternoons. The eldest child travelled to the US four months ago.

Reina works looking after animals in her house. She has chickens and pigs. Reina learned this trade from a young age from her parents. They taught her this work and, now, it is a source of income. Reina's children help her look after the animals.

Reina is applying for this loan in order to buy pig feed to fatten up her pigs and to earn a higher income when she sells them. Said income will be very useful for paying some household costs.

Reina wants to fatten up the pigs so as to sell them in December, which is when one of her children will graduate. Reina wants to buy him his uniform and celebrate his graduation. Reina also wants to continue helping her son so that he continues with his studies.

loans.use: to buy feed to give to her pigs.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth works hard to support her family. Janeth is married and has a firewood-vending business in the Philippines.

Janeth requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell.

Janeth has been in this business for one year now.

Janeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is from Masis town. He has been providing electricity repair service for locals for many years. Suren receives orders from different individuals and provides them with high quality service.

Due to his experience and professional work, Suren has already gained a good list of clients who value the work and service that he provides. Now, this hardworking man applies for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for his work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a great support for Suren to be able to continue providing service in a more effective way.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing electricity repair service

loans.name: Ep Mutaho Group

texts.fr: Le client Kitumbo est un commerçant depuis 2 ans, président et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Ep Mutaho », âgé de 59 ans et père de 14 enfants, dont 11 étudient et les 3 autres se sont déjà mariés. Il est vendeur d’haricots. Il installe sa marchandise dans le marché de la ville. Il a sollicité un crédit auprès de Hekima. Il va acheter 6 sacs d’haricots pour accroitre son activité. Sa conjointe est une ménagère. Il avait commencé avec ses fonds perçu de son salaire. Dans l’avenir, Il souhaite scolariser, soigner et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, Il remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs en leur octroyant de crédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
This client, Kitumbo, has been a merchant for two years. He is the president and a member of the business collective "Ep Mutaho". He is 59 years old and a father with fourteen children, of whom eleven are students, and the three others are already married. Kitumbo sets up his merchandise at the town's market. He is requesting a loan from Hekima. He is going to purchase 6 sacks of beans to increase his business. His wife is a housekeeper. He had started off with funds from her salary. 

For the future, he would like to provide education, care, and food for his children. Thus, he thanks Hekima for its support for small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system by granting them no-collateral loans.

loans.use: to purchase beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for sewing machine for providing clothing renewal service

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en: Jean Marie Vianney is 32 years old. He is single, and has been selling foodstuffs for the last two years. He would like to use the new loan to buy potatoes, beans and cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, beans and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Hugo Vladimir

texts.es:
Hugo de 26 años de edad, trabaja en una ferretería, pero también esta estudiando en la universidad profesorado en ciencias de la educación. Actualmente, esta acompañado por ahorita no tienen hijos,vive en casa familiar con su suegra y dos cuñados. 

 
Por el momento es empleado, pero quiere iniciar un negocio de un comedor junto a su compañera de vida, el cual ella lo administrara, ya que ella esta actualmente trabajando en una librería pero ya tiene cinco años y no le aumentan el sueldo y  viendo otra perspectiva han decidido poner el negocio el horario sera de 5.A.M a 4.P.M.

 El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar cacerolas,platos,mesa térmica,vasos,licuadora y otros utensilios para la cocina y pintura para que el local este en buena presentación para iniciar con el comedor.

El cliente manifiesta que ya teniendo el negocio establecido, generara mas ingresos y  por supuesto mas clientes y tratar de atender bien a la clientela, con un buen servicio las ganancias las utilizara para cancelar la cuota y lo demás invertirlo en los alimentos del día a día y  seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Hugo is 26 years old and works in a DIY shop. He is also studying to be a teacher. Hugo is married but, for now, the couple does not have children. The couple lives in the family house wife Hugo's mother- and two brothers-in-law.

Hugo currently has a job but he wants to start his own restaurant with his wife. She will run the business. She has been working in a bookshop for five years but has not been given a pay rise. With this loan opportunity the couple has decided to start this business, which will open from 5am until 4pm.

Hugo will use this loan to buy pots and pans, dishes, a steam table, glasses, blenders and other utensils for cooking; he will also buy paint so that the premises look nice when the restaurant opens.

Hugo tells us that once the business is set up he will earn a higher income and have more customers. Hugo will try to treat the customers well, offering good service. Hugo's profits will be used to pay off his debt and to invest in the food he needs every day. He will continue to work with the loan organisation.

loans.use: to buy pots and pans, dishes, a steam table, glasses, blenders and other utensils for cooking; he will also buy paint so that the premises look nice when the restaurant opens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is going to organize a new business sewing national dresses for women. She is a good sewer.  Nilufar is married but she does not have any children.

She is going to organize her own sewing business. Nilufar studied at a course ‘To Get Ahead’ for women organizing. She will sew national dresses for the women of her village in her house.

She is asking for a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy fabrics for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for organizing new business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area that is accessible, and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be an increase in the price of clothes. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale operation within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will become a successful entrepreneur. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to open another boutique.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis was born in the year 1981. She is married and has a son.

She is going to organize a new business sewing and selling national clothing for men called ‘chap an’. Nargis learned from her mother how to sew ‘chap an’. Nargis will sew ‘chap an’ in her house and than sell it in a local market. Nargis took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ for women organizing.

She is asking for a loan of 1,200 somoni to buy fabrics for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for organizing new business

loans.name: Ahmet

texts.en: Ahmet wants to buy again seeds such as potato and onion for planting. He has started already preparing the soil.

loans.use: To buy seeds (potato and onion) for seasonal planting

loans.name: Tres Hermanos Group

texts.es:
Tres Hermanos es un grupo familiar está conformado por los hermanos Doña Marcela, Fernando y Don Rafael quien es el esposo de Marcela, pero en la comunidad todos piensan que los tres son hermanos y por ello decidieron usar ese nombre para su grupo. Los integrantes siempre están juntos, se consideran unos aventureros, tienen mucha comunicación entre ellos y se ayudan mutuamente. Ellos viven en una comunidad pequeña, pero muy tranquila, anteriormente el trasporte era muy escaso y ahora ya circulan mas taxis.
Don Rafael está casado con Marcela desde hace 19 años, juntos ha formado una familia con tres hijos los cuales aun se encuentran estudiando. Don Rafael se dedica a la venta de pollos y ropa, esta vez con su crédito invertirá en sus negocios pero también está pensando en invertir en piñatas por la temporada decembrina. Rafael es comerciante desde hace 12 años, anteriormente vivía con su familia en otra cuidad, pero debido a algunas circunstancias de la vida se cambiaron de domicilio. En su antiguo negocio vendía fantasía (joyería de fantasía, accesorios y maquillaje) pero en la comunidad en la que vive no era muy comercial, Don Rafael comento: “a las señoras de antes no les gustaba maquillarse como ahora”. Ahora, Don Rafael se dedica a la venta de pollos y ropa, él sale a vender a otras comunidades aprovecha los tianguis o algún evento importante en algún punto del municipio. Don Rafael no tienen ningún problema con sus negocios, aunque a veces tenga ventas bajas sus ánimos no decaen sino todo lo contrario, está muy interesado en comprar algunos terrenos para iniciar a construir locales y también vender en las plazas para así aumentar un poco más sus ganancias para tener asegurada la educación de sus hijos. Doña Marce, como la conocen, invertirá en su negocio de ropa y Fernando, en artículos electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
“Tres Hermanos” (“Three siblings”) is a family communal bank. Its members are the siblings Marcela and Fernando, and Rafael, who is Marcela’s husband, but in the community everyone thinks that they three are siblings and therefore they decided to use this name for their bank. The members are always together, they considers themselves to be adventurers, talk to each other a lot and are helping one another. They live in a small and very quiet community where transportation used to be very scarce, but now there are more taxis.

Rafael has been married to Marcela for 19 years and together they have three children who are still at school. Rafael works selling chickens and clothes. This time he wants to invest the loan his business, but he is also considering investing in piñatas for the holiday season. Rafael has been a merchant for 12 years. He previously lived with his family in another city, but due to some circumstances of life they moved away. In his old business he sold decorative items (costume jewelry, accessories, and make-up), but in the community where he lives now there was not much commercial potential. Rafael says: “Before, the ladies did not like make-up as they do now.”

Now Rafael sells chickens and clothes. He travels to other communities and sells in street markets or at important events everywhere in the area. Rafael does not have any problems with his business although sometimes he does not sell much. But his mood does not sink - on the contrary: he is very much interested in buying land to set up premises and also in selling in the squares in order to increase his income a bit and by this to secure the education of his children.

Marce, as you know, will invest in her clothes business and Fernando in electrical appliances.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Wend La Malgda Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNA représente le groupe WEND LA  MALGDA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des céréales  depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 06 sacs de 100kg de maïs.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne  s’acheter une moto et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. MAMOUNA represents the group WEND LA  MALGDA. She is doing very well. She is a married mother of seven children. The oldest is 28 years old, and the youngest is 11. Three go to school, and she has five persons to support. Ms. MAMOUNA has been selling grains for eleven years. She gets her supplies at the market in her sector. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase six 100-kg sacks of corn. With the profits, she wants to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to purchase a motorbike and to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr:
Mr WENDINMI représente le groupe ESPOIR.  Il se porte bien. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le 01mois. 01 va à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Il vend de produits de beauté depuis 02ans. Il s’approvisionne  au grand marché. Ses clients  sont les  hommes et les femmes.
Mr veut s’acheter 05douzaines de parfums, 04douzaines de produits de beauté.
IL  désire épargner ses bénéfices. Il ambitionne s’acquérir une moto  et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. WENDINMI represents the group ESPOIR. He is doing well. He is a married father of three children. The oldest is 7 years old, the [youngest] is 1 month old. One goes to school. Mr. WENDINMI has four persons to support. He has been selling beauty products for two years. He gets his supplies at the big market. His customers include both men and women. He wants to purchase 5 dozen of perfumes and 4 of beauty products. He would like to save his profits. His ambition is to acquire a motorbike and to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Yort

texts.en:
Yort is a resident of a rural village in the Ou Reang Ov district. She is a 31-year-old mother of two children. The family's main sources of income are from rice farming and pig raising, through which she earns about US $19 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Yort is going to use this loan to buy a machine for milling rice in her village. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a rice milling machine

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Meryem

texts.en:
Meryem has sewn trousseau items for a living for 30 years. She now has a store after working from home for many years. In this way, she raised two children and was able to send them to university, says Meryem, who is not afraid of difficulties and doesn’t give up. Even when she had health problems, she didn’t stop working and says women must earn money to be strong. “I have to be a strong mother, so I have to earn money,” she said.  

She’ll use the loan to buy goods and materials for her store, and in the future, she plans to earn enough money to be able to help women in difficult situations.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Meryem Hanım çeyiz malzemeleri dikerek geçimini sağlıyor 30 yıldır.  Uzun yıllar boyunca evden yaptığı içi için artık bir dükkanı var.  İki çocuğunu bu sayede yetiştirip üniversite okutabildiğini söyleyen Meryem Hanım’ın zorluklardan yılmayan ve vazgeçmeyen güçlü bir yapısı var.  Sağlık problemleri yaşadığı donemde bile çalışmaktan hiç vazgeçmemiş ve kadınların guclu olmak ıcın para kazanmasının şart olduğunu soyluyor.  Ben guclu bır anne olmak zorundaydım ve bu yuzden para kazanmam gerekıyordu dıyor.  Mikro krediyle dukanı ıcın mal malzeme aldı ve ileride zor durumdakı kadınlara yardım edebılecek kadar para kazanmayı planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy goods and materials

loans.name: Vildan

texts.en:
Vildan has been a tailor for 22 years. She encountered a number of difficulties. Sometimes she was very worn out, but she didn’t give up. Vildan paid the school expenses of her two grown children, and in order to be a standing and productive mother, she never gave up working. In time, she began saving to expand and be able to train other women to sew. When she learned about Maya, she was very happy. She aims to buy goods and materials for her store and hire workers to expand.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Vildan hanım 22 yıldır terzilik yapıyor.  Bu sure ıcınde turlu zorluklarla karşılaştığını, zaman zaman cok yoruldugunu ama asla vazgecmedıgını soyluyor.  Şu an iki yetişkin çocuğu olan Vildan Hanım onların okul masraflarının yanı sıra hayata karşı dik duran ve üreten bir anne olmak için çalışmaktan hiç vazgeçmemiş.  Zaman içinde kendini geliştirmiş ve diğer kadınlara dikiş hocalığı yapabilecek birikime ulaşmış.  Maya ile tanıştığı için çok mutlu.  Dükkanına mal ve malzeme alıyor ve yanında işçi  çalıştırabilecek kadar buyumeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy goods and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Aybegün

texts.en:
Aybegün sews women’s clothing. Responsible for looking after her family, Aybegün was determined to succeed as she began work with a single sewing machine. She thought no one would support her. When she learned about Maya, she was able to buy a very important industrial iron. With her second loan she bought cloth and thread. 

She thought her life was a series of difficulties. She knows being a woman is already difficult, and for a woman who has to earn money without support, working is more difficult. She wants Maya to gain strength and extend its services, providing steady support. In the future, she also wants to help women who need support.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Aybegün Hanım kadın kıyafetleri dikiyor.  Ailesine bakmakla yukumlu olan Aybegün hanım tek bir makinayla başladığı esnaflıkta başarılı olmakta kararlı.  Bu çabalarında kendısıne kımsenın destek olmadığını dusunurken Maya ile tanıştığını ve işi için cok onemlı olan sanayi tipi ütüyü alabildiğini soyluyor.  2. Kredisiyle de toplan kumaş  ve iplik alarak kazançlı bir alışveriş yaptığını belırtıyor.  Hayatının mucadeleden ıbaret oldugunu dusuyor.  Kadın olmak zaten zorken desteği olmayan ve para kazanmak zorunda olan bir kadının işinin daha zor olduğunu biliyor.  Maya sayesinde guclenmek ve yere sağlam basmak istiyor.  İlerde kendısı de destege ıhtıyacı olan kadınlara fayda sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya is 37 years of age and she is in a relationship with her life companion. She has been blessed with four children of various ages, who are completely dependent on Ya's and her husband’s incomes. 

Ya earns a living by farming rice and raising poultry at home, while her husband is in the fishing business. Ya has managed her current businesses well and has been in doing these for years. 

With this investment, Ya will buy feed for her poultry, so that she can fatten them until they are fully grown, to sell in the markets. 

Her priority is to see her children become professionals, so that they will have more opportunities for development. Ya is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their donations.

loans.use: to buy feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, age 19, lives in Gaza. He was not given the opportunity to complete his higher education, but chose not to let this stop him from improving his life. He therefore completed a course in phone repair. He has worked in this field in several shops over the past three years.

Now that Mohammad has gained three years of valuable experience, he has decided to open his own workshop. He is requesting a youth loan in order to buy repair equipment with which to start his new business. He will also buy a display box for his phones. This investment will increase his income and help him to improve the financial conditions of his family.

Mohammad wants to thank everyone who chooses to help him achieve success in his new enterprise. He believes that this loan will increase his earning potential and improve his life.

loans.use: to buy phone repair equipment and a phone display box for his new workshop

loans.name: Semra

texts.en:
Semra successfully became an artisan despite many difficulties, lack of support from her family and having small children. She produces decorations and trousseau items using a technique rarely done in her city. The products she makes are all specialized hand work. 

Semra experienced very hard conditions, and obstacles were always in her way, but rather than demoralize her, they motivated her. Striving to stay on her feet for long periods, Semra’s hard work and ingenuity earned her a place on the market with larger and older artisans. 

When she first learned about Maya, she bought goods and materials to expand her selection. With her second loan, she bought a computer and began to show her products on the Internet, reaching more people. Her goal is to gather women like herself, who face difficult conditions, under one roof and provide them opportunities.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Semra Hanım tum zorluklara, ailesinden destek gormemesine ve kucuk cocuğuna rağmen esnaf olmayı başarmış bir kadın.  Bulunduğu şehirde çok kullanılmayan bir teknikle ozel gunler için süslemeler ve çeyiz malzemeleri üretiyor.  Urettiği ürünlerin hepsi ozel el yapımı.  Semra Hanım çok zor şartlarda yaşadığını, onune sureklı engeller cıktıgını ancak bu durumun onu yıldırmak yerıne aksine daha çok motive ettiğini soyluyor.  Buyuk ve eski esnafların içinde uzun sure ayakta durma mucadelesi veren Semra Hanım çalışkanlığı ve yaratıcılığı sayesinde piyasada nihayet yer edinebilmiş.  Maya ile ilk tanışmasında mal ve malzeme alarak ürün çeşitliliğini artırırken 2. Kredisiyle bilgisayar alarak yaptığı ürünleri internette sergilemeyi ve bu sayede daha cok kişiye ulaşmayı başardı.  Hedefinde kendisi gibi zor şartlarda olan urtici kadınlara bir çatı altında toplamak ve onlara iş imkanı sağlamak var.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Alivera

texts.en: Alivera is 44 years old. She is married to a teacher. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 12 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more maize and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She would love to have a depot in the future.

loans.use: To buy more maize beans for sale.

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Thorng is 42 years old, married and has three school-going children who are in different grades. Thorng and his wife help each other to manage their farming business to support their children together. Thorng learned to do farming from his parents and inherited a few pieces of farmland after his marriage. With his little income, Thorng saves some money with the ambition of owning large farming areas, and he continues to develop his business because he wants to give his children a better quality of life. He has been doing this for nearly 15 years, and he earns a daily income of USD 15.90 per day.

He will use the loan to build a latrine at home in order to improve his family’s sanitation and hygiene. Their healthiness is his priority. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Thorng to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a latrine at home in order to improve the family’s sanitation and hygiene.

loans.name: Faizulo

texts.ru:
Файзуло опытный дехканин, ему 57 лет. Он 41 лет жизни посвятил работе на земле. Все эти годы он выращивал сельскохозяйственные культуры и за счет его прибыли обеспечивал семью. Файзуло живет с женой, двумя сыновьями, двумя невестками и внуками в районе Джиликуль. Его жена портниха, а сыновья уехали на заработки в чужие края. 
Сейчас Файзуло активно готовится к озимым посевам. Его дехканское хозяйство состоит из 5 га участка земли. Он уже с этих земель собрал хлопок и теперь хочет посеять пшеницу. Для этой цели он обратился за кредитом. Файзуло на сумму кредита собирается купить минеральные удобрения и семена пшеницы.
texts.en:
Faizulo is an experienced farmer. He is 57 years old. He has dedicated himself to working with the land for 41 years. All these years he has grown field crops and his income from this has supported the family. 

Faizulo lives with his wife, two sons, two daughters-in-law and grandchildren in the Jilikul region. His wife is a seamstress and his sons have gone to work as migrant workers in foreign lands. 

Currently Faizulo prepares actively for the winter crops. His dekhan farm consists of five hectares of land. On this land he has already harvested cotton, and how he would like to sow wheat. With this aim he applied for a loan. Faizulo has decided to purchase mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds for the loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim, 33 years old, is married and blessed with three children who are attending school. She currently lives with her family in her own house located in Kampong Thom province. Farming and fish selling are the family's major sources of income. Sarim has been a market vendor for more than 13 years, earning a daily income of KHR 27,000, which is normally used for food and school fees for her children. 

To help her further develop the family's farming business, Sarim needs to borrow a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy a plowing machine to maintain the rice fields. In addition, a trailer can be attached to this machine to transport goods, especially rice in the harvest season. Sarim hopes the loan will enable her to continue growing her business and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine for the rice fields.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam, 37 years old, lives in Gaza at Beet Hanoon with her husband and four children. For the past three years, she has run a food market in a rented space. All the neighbors prefer to buy from her because of her good treatment and good staff. Ahlam's business has helped the family income because her husband works in a public institution, earning a low salary. They are a big family and need to ensure their children's well-being.

Ahlam is requesting a loan of $1,500 to buy a cash machine and shelves so she can increase her stock. She hopes to buy a grocery in the future. Ahlam is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a cash machine and shelves

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan works hard to support her family. Joan is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. Joan has been in this business for 10 years now.

Joan requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

In the future, Joan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years now.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 38 years old and married with one child. Laila works very hard to provide for them.

Laila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shampoo, bread, noodles, sugar, detergent soap, eggs, etc. to sell.

Laila has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, bread, noodles, sugar, detergent soap, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Laila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like shampoo, bread, noodles, sugar, detergent soap, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leila is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Leila has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leila requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, noodles, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

Leila has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Leila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, noodles, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business.

Letecia has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. Leonora is single and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

Leonora has been in this business for 15 years now.

Leonora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marlon Enrique

texts.es:
Marlon, se dispone a mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y necesita completar el el dinero para comprar una moto, que le facilitara salir a vender pan y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior logro incrementar su producción, gano clientes nuevos, sus ventas son mayores su economía ha mejorado con lo que cancelo sus cuotas y sigue aportando en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Marlon intends to improve his business conditions and for that he needs to come up with the money to buy a motorcycle which will help him to sell bread and give his customers a better service. 

With the previous loan he managed to increase his production and his sales, he was able to gain new customers, and his finances improved thus allowing him to pay his fees. He also keeps helping with the household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo is 37 years old, married, with three children, from Samtredia district. Sergo's mother lives with the family, as well. The family lives without a source of income, in absolute poverty, and gets only small-sized social assistance from the local government. 

In order to meet his increasing household expenses and generate food money for his children, Sergo is requesting a loan. He will buy a stock of merchandise at wholesale prices to start a sales business among community members. He and his wife will offer their clients a wide assortment of winter clothing, linens, and various household items, and give them the option of paying later for their purchases. 

The loan will enable Sergo to earn a profit and to save money to satisfy the everyday needs of his family. He awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, age 26, is from the village of Abedati. She is divorced and has two children. Ana lives with her parents, retired grandmother, brother, uncle and aunt. The family runs an agricultural business to earn a living, growing maize, nuts and persimmons on their own plot of land. Anna dries the persimmons and sells the fruit at the local open market. She also breeds two milk cows and one calf. The women of the family make cheese to sell and for family consumption.

In order to meet increasing household expenses and to generate income for this large family's well being, Ana is requesting a loan. She will buy stocks of merchandise at wholesale prices to start a sales business. She will offer her clients a wide assortment of winter clothing, linens and various household items and give them the option of paying later for their purchases. The loan will enable Ana to earn more profit and to save more money to satisfy the family's everyday needs. She awaits your generosity

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing and household items for resale

loans.name: Boezemwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme P. ANNE MARIE représente le groupe BOEZEMWENDE. S.CLARISSE se porte bien mais elle ne fait plus partie du groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 03 va à l’école. 
Mme vente de sel  depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les femmes, les filles de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter 08sacs de sel de 25kg.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne étendre le champs de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. P. ANNE MARIE represents the group BOEZEMWENDE. She is doing well, but she is no longer part of the group. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 13 years old, and the youngest is 3. Three go to school. Ms. P. ANNE MARIE has been selling salt for two years. She gets her supplies at the market in her sector. Her customers include women and girls in her sector. She wants to purchase eight 25-kg sacks of salt. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to expand her field of business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase salt

loans.name: Filwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU représente le groupe FILWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme vend des ignames  depuis 14ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les femmes  et hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 04sacs d’ignames.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices construire une maison d’habitation. Elle ambitionne étendre le champ de son activité et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. BINTOU represents the group FILWENDE. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 11. One goes to school. She has six persons to support. Ms. BINTOU has been selling yams for fourteen years. She gets her supplies from the market in her sector. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase 4 sacks of yams. She wants to save her profits and build a house. Her ambition is to expand her field of business and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase yams

loans.name: Tongnooma Group

texts.fr:
