Mme SOMPASSEKDE représente le groupe TONGNOOMA. Mariée, elle est mère de 01enfant. Il est âgé de 04ans. Il ne va à l’école. Elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes, des habits prêt à porter  depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les femmes  et hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 balle de pagnes.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices afin d’agrandir son secteur d’activité. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. SOMPASSEKDE represents the group TONGNOOMA. She is a married mother of one child, aged 4 years old. He does not go to school. Ms. SOMPASSEKDE has three persons to support. She has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and ready-to-wear clothing for four years. She gets her supplies at the market in her sector. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase a bale of 'pagne' cloth. She wants to reinvest her profits to expand her business sector. Her ambition is to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase traditional cloth

loans.name: Mahpudin

texts.en:
The loan Mahpudin got from Kiva allowed him to process more transactions on mobile phone airtime credits, especially on weekends when sales are high. 

Mahpudin hopes that he can grow his business even more now that he is taking another Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. He thanks Kiva and all the participating lenders for the support.

loans.use: To process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Ajat

texts.en:
The loan Ajat got from Kiva allows him to process more transactions on mobile phone airtime credits, especially on weekends when sales are at the peak. 

Ajat hopes that he can grow his business even more now that he is taking another Kiva loan as working capital for processing transactions. He thanks Kiva and all the participating lenders for the support.

In the photo, Ajat stands on the left, while Arya, Ruma's field officer, is on the right.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim lives in Bogor, a city located at a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. 

Hakim's first loan from Kiva allowed him to process more transactions on mobile phone airtime credits, especially on weekends when sales are at the peak. 

As his business continues to grow, Hakim is taking another Kiva loan that he needs as working capital to process more transactions. He thanks you for your support.

In the photo, Hakim stands on the left, with his daughter, his wife, and Ruma's field officer.

loans.use: To process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Rosidin

texts.en:
Rosidin lives in Bogor, a city located at a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. 

Rosidin used his first loan from Kiva to process more transactions on mobile phone airtime credits, especially on weekends when sales are at the peak.

As his business continues to grow, Rosidin is taking another Kiva loan that he needs as working capital to process more transactions. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Endang owns a small shop selling snacks, drinks, drinking water, and mobile phone airtime credit. Endang used his first loan from Kiva to support more transactions on mobile phone airtime credits. The loan helped him to generate more sales, especially on weekends when people tend to buy mobile phone airtime credits. 

As his business continues to grow, Endang is taking another Kiva loan that he needs as working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, age 41, operates a beauty parlor. She has been engaged in her business for many years and offers such services as makeup, hair styling, and facials. She has gained many regular customers over the years and earns enough to supplement her husband's income and help sustain her family's needs.

Shaheen hopes to attract more regular customers to her business. To achieve this goal, she requires larger quantities of hair care products, skin products, bleaching agents, and whitening creams to stock in her parlor. She has therefore applied for a loan in the amount of Rs. 40,000 through Kashf Foundation.   She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. 

She is very experienced in her profession and is confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: hair care products, skin products, bleaching agents, and whitening creams for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, aged 62 years old, is a resident of Kenga in Kibaale district. He is married and has 12 children aged between 35 and 14; only three are in school, but he also stays with three dependents who are orphans.

John has approached Ugafode for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to complete his house, and he intends to pay it back using proceeds from his market tendering business. His dream is to see all his children complete school and support themselves.

In his business, according to him, he is mainly challenged by seasonality and bad weather that sometimes affects the operations of the market.

John describes himself as hardworking family man who loves his family.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Haoulatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Mai 2010. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation de produits agricoles.

Madame Haoulatou (en basin jaune) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 garçons. C’est une femme très active et maîtrise bien son activité de gérante de four traditionnel qu’elle détient dans son quartier. De même il jouit d’une bonne «expérience dans ce domaine et emploi deux jeunes de son quartier pour la production de pain traditionnel. Ces  derniers sont rémunérés   à hauteur de 1 500 F CFA par sac produits.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 20 sacs de farine, du bois chauffe, de la levure et du carbonate et un sac de sel.

Avec les bénéfices générés par cette activité, elle prend en charge les frais scolaires de ses garçons et continue la finition de sa maison.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very active in the village bank which was created in 2010. They all come from the same neighbourhood and get on well together. Their main activity is small business and the transformation of farm products.

Mrs. Haoulatou (wearing yellow) is the main borrower. She is married with three sons. She is very active and does a good job as the manager of the traditional oven that she owns in the neighbourhood. She also has considerable experience in this field and employs local young people for the production of traditional bread. These young people are paid 1500 F CFA per bag produced.

With her new loan, she plans to buy 20 bags of flour, firewood, yeast and carbonate and a bag of salt.

With the profits generated by this business, she will pay for her sons' school fees and continue to put the finishing touches to her home.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of flour, firewood, yeast and carbonate and a bag of salt.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 27 years old. She is married with two children. She has been in business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and maize for sale.

loans.name: Ja'far

texts.ru: Чаъфар 38-летний житель района Джиликуль. У него высшее образование. Он закончил Международный Исламский Университет города Исламабада. Он женат и является отцом 2-летнего сына. Чаъфар одновременно занимается двумя делами. Он имеет орошаемый участок земли, где со своей семьей выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Еще у него есть точка обслуживания, где он предоставляет свои услуги по ремонту телефонов и компьютера. Чаъфару в ведении растениеводства помогают жена и брат. Он занимается данным делом последние 7 лет. В данный момент Чаъфару необходимо успеть провести озимый посев. Для этой цели он берет кредит, чтобы купить семена пшеницы и минеральные удобрения. Чаъфар сейчас работает усердно, чтобы накопить сбережение и построить свой дом, а сейчас он с женой и сыном живет в родительском доме.
texts.en:
Ja'far is a 38 years old resident of the Jilikul region. He has higher education. He finished the International Islamic University in the city of Islamabad. He is married and is the father of a two years old son. 

Ja'far has two jobs at the same time. He has a plot of irrigated land, where he and his family grow crops. He also has a service shop, where he offers his service of repairing phones and computers. Ja'far's wife and brother help him with the agricultural business. He has worked with this activity for the last seven years. 

Currently, Ja'far needs to spend time on sowing winter crops. With this aim he takes a loan in order to purchase wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers. Ja'far works hard in order to save money and build his own house, as he, his wife and his son currently live in his parents' home.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nail

texts.en:
Nail is a taxi driver. He is 37 years old, married and has two children. One of them is 9 and goes to second class of school; the other goes to pre-school. His wife is a housewife. 

Nail’s motherland, Agdam city, was occupied by Armenians already 20 years ago, so today they are IDP (internally displaced persons). Now Nail lives with his family in the Abseron region. 

Nail is a taxi driver, so he transports passengers between various areas of the Abseron region. Nail wants to increase his business and therefore he has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1,500 Azerbaijan new manat. With this loan Nail wants to repair his car. 

He is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help. In the future Nail wants to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Theang

texts.en:
Theang is 32 years old and a married woman who has two independent children. She lives with her spouse and children in a rural area of Santuk district, Kampong Thom province. Theang works in the agricultural sector, primarily growing rice with the main support from her husband. Farming is the sole source of her family’s income. She has been in this occupation for nearly 14 years and earns a daily income of USD 5.45 per day.

Theang is seeking a loan in order to build a safe latrine for her household since she wants to keep them healthier. This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, and concrete rings and also to pay for the labor costs. Her dream is to continue to develop her farming, so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, and concrete rings and also to pay for the labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Irza

texts.en:
Irza is single and lives with his parents. He is 25 years old. For over 3 years, Irza has been in the cobbler business. He learned this profession from his father. Today his father is old and doesn’t work in the business. Irza’s mother is a housewife. So, Irza meets all the needs of his family. They have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Khojaly city for 21 years and now live in the Abseron region. 

Today, Irza needs a loan amount of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). It’s his first loan and with this loan he wants to buy new materials, for example different heel of shoes, color of shoes, animal skins and etc. Also he wants to repair his apparatus. Irza is thankful to the Kiva organization for this loan. In the future, he wants to get married and have a lovely family.

loans.use: to buy new materials and to repair his apparatus.

loans.name: Haziz

texts.en:
Haziz wants to buy water pipes and peach seedlings for planting. He also wants to do some service to some sort of water tank he currently has with a loan of 200,000 Albanian Lek that he is requesting from Kiva lenders. He has been doing agriculture for the past 20 years, mostly planting, harvesting and selling fresh veggies, peaches and grapefruits to the farmers’ market of their nearby town. Sometimes he produces in quantities and sells the products to the wholesalers/buyers. 

Haziz is in his fifties and is married and has three children. His parents live with him as well, and this is in accordance with the Albanian culture.

loans.use: to buy peach seedlings and water pipes

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 28 years old. She is married with three children. She sells various merchandise in her boutique. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, cooking oil, lotions and some foodstuffs for sale. She plans to use the profits for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, cooking oil and lotions for sale.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Don Rafael es un señor muy trabajar, el tiene una finca con vacas, pero actualmente se le complica el poder atender de manera correcta a los animales. En la zona la lluvia no permite que se pueda usar otro medio de transporte que no sea el cuadraciclo, por lo que el solicita un préstamo de novecientos mil colones (900.000) para comprar un cuadraciclo y poder llevar la materia prima a la finca. El espera poder tener mas facilidades y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Don Rafael is a hard-working man.  He raises cattle for sale, but the heavy rains in this region make maintenance work difficult.  He is applying for a 900,000-colones loan that he will use to buy a quadcycle, a motorized vehicle that is the most practical means of carting supplies around his farm to feed and maintain his herd.  He wants to grow his business so that he can continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for livestock maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale to use in providing services as a Community Knowledge Worker.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and she has three children who are still in school.

Leticia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Leticia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn lives in Yerevan with his wife and 22-year-old daughter. 

He provides auto repair service. Vahagn's wife is a teacher at a local school and his daughter works as a nurse. The whole family works hard to gather enough income for sustaining their living. 

Because of financial hardships, Vahagn is now unable to purchase materials needed for his work. So he has applied for this loan to purchase materials and provide auto repair service. 

Vahagn has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

He will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to provide auto repair services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine, 32, is a married woman with four children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jasmine has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Jasmine requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

In the future, Jasmine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 43-year-old married woman. For the past 2 years, she has been successfully running a business selling milk to contribute to the family income. Over time, Shahnaz has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to pay for household expenditures. Shahnaz’s husband's income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family alone. 

Shahnaz is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR through the Kashf Foundation to purchase one more buffalo. It will help her to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es: Gricelda, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijas, reside en el municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa, cerca de Peña Blanca. Hace 4 años decidió junto a su esposo establecer un negocio de pulpería donde vende granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, condimentos, churros, refrescos, dulces etc. El préstamo que esta solicitando es el segundo ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar granos básicos, refrescos, azúcar, manteca, huevos, pan, churros etc. para surtir y poder incrementar las ventas. Los planes son mantener el negocio y apoyar a sus hijas.
texts.en: Gricelda, 36, and her husband have two daughters.  They live in the rural town of San Francisco de Yojoa near Peña Blanca.  Gricelda and her husband decided to start a corner grocery 4 years ago.  They sell grains, sugar, butter, condiments, churros, soft drinks, snacks, etc.  Gricelda is applying for her second loan, this one for 10,000 lempiras, so that she can stock the grocery with the products she sells: grains, soft drinks, sugar, butter, eggs, bread, churros, etc.  The investment will allow her to carry on the business and better support her children.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli, 24 years old, lives with his wife and 2 small children in the Zugdidi district. His wife is a housekeeper who takes care of the children. The family's only source of income is transfers from abroad that a relative sends every month, which is hardly enough for Irakli to support his four-member family.

Irakli wants to start a stable business and open a general store. He has already arranged the space where his store will be located, but the business needs support for further development. It seems to be a profitable venture for its location and necessity. His regular customers will be locals and passersby. 

Local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from borrowers. Irakli has received credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, called Start-up Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Irakli will use this loan of 2,000 USD to purchase a wide assortment of products and to have money for working capital. Irakli believes that the business will be lucrative. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a wide assortment of products and to have money for  working capital

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 41, runs a small general store along with her husband, who is shown with her in the picture. Together, they purchase stock from the market and deal with customers at the shop. Over the years, Naseem and her husband have become well-known in their community for providing high-quality products, and they are able to earn enough to meet the expenses of their five children. 

Naseem has requested a loan in the amount of Rs. 45,000 in order to buy biscuits, beverages, and packs of salt to meet with increasing demand at their store. She is expecting boost in her earnings as a result of this loan investment. 

She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, beverages, and packs of salt

loans.name: Suryia

texts.en:
Suryia is a 41-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has ten years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market since he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Suryia is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

Suryia wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, tea, oil, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future. Suryia is in her fourth loan cycle, with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, tea, oil, and beverages.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad, age 51, deals in a business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Safya

texts.en: Safya is 36 years old and a married woman (sitting in rickshaw as shown in the picture) and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Safya’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. The rickshaw now requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Safya has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Safya is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman lives in Vanadzor town. He is married and has a 2-year-old daughter. Arman has been providing construction and renovation services to locals for 5 years. He is the hardworking father of the family, who does his best to provide appropriate living conditions. Arman currently asks for a loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for his work.

Arman has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly help Arman and he will be very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing renovation and construction services

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of five children.  

Five years ago, she started her business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. 

Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is in her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has shown good repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Эту милую женщину в платке зовут Ситора. Ей 33 года. Он мать троих детей и верная жена. Ситора с семьей живет на районе Рудаки. Район Рудаки находится рядом с городом Душанбе, столицей Таджикистана. Муж Ситоры работает таксистом. Они вместе воспитывают двоих детей, пятилетнего сына и трехлетнюю девочку. Ситора работает учительницей в местной школе, но в свободное время от работы она проводит рядом со швейной машинкой. Ситоре нравиться шить кроить таджикские национальные платья. Она хочет продолжить заниматься этой работой, но ее швейная машинка не пригодна для использования. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить швейную машинку и продолжить свою работу. Ситора надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: The sweet woman in the dress is named Sitora. She is 33 years old, the mother of three children, and a faithful wife. She and her family live in the Rudaki area, which is near the city of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. Sitora's husband works as a taxi driver. Together they are raising two children, a five year old son and three year old daughter. Sitora is a teacher at a local school, but when not working she spends her free time with a sewing machine. She enjoys cutting and sewing traditional Tajik dresses. She wants to continue with this work, but her sewing machine isn't working any more. She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and continue her work. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He describes himself to be creative and self-driven. He operates a retail business where he sells drinks, books and other items. He also operates an M-pesa business (a mobile-phone based money-transfer service). He describes his family challenge to be poor drainage in the area in which they live. 

He will use the 120,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water-storage facility and add stock of drinks, books, M-pesa float credits and other items he sells in his business. This will enable him to have enough stock to sell to customers; hence, increasing his income. The water-storage facility will enable his family to store clean water for domestic use. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 80,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water-storage facility for his family and add stock of drinks, books, M-pesa money-transfer float credits and other items

loans.name: Villeta Poty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad de Itá, son 20 mujeres que se unieron con el propósito de poder crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas, ya que quieren dar a su familia todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gilda  es una de las integrantes que por medio de su arduo trabajo y las ventas que hace en su despensa, viene mejorando su calidad de vida. Ella es una persona que tiene muchas ansias de superarse, y siempre esta con mucho entusiasmo.
La Sra. Gilda solicita de este crédito para la compra de aceite, harina ,azúcar, leche, entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group was organized in the city of Itá.  The group's 20 members have a common purpose: to grow as businesswomen and in every other way, as well.  They hope to provide their families with everything that they weren't able to have themselves.  
Sra. Gilda is one of the group's members.  She has worked hard to build a grocery business so that she can better support herself and her family.  She wants to grow the business further and is pursuing her goal with great tenacity.
Sra. Gilda is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her grocery with cooking oil, flour, sugar, milk and other merchandise. The investment will help her to meet her goal for the business and, in turn, increase her income.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for local workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small plot of cropland.

loans.name: Livine

texts.en:
Livine is 36 years old. She is married with two children. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 37 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Liezel works very hard to provide for them.

Liezel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. Liezel has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, cooking oil, and other goods. Liezel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Esmeralda Rocio

texts.es:
Esmeralda vive en la ciudad de Chincha, tiene 42 años y trabaja como promotora de ventas en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Esmeralda esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta mejorar la calidad de su familia sobre todo tiene una hija de 7 años, así ella seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija”.
texts.en:
Esmeralda lives in the city of Chincha.  She is 42 years old, and she works as a sales promoter for a small company in the city.  She gets income from this, which she uses to be able to get ahead.

Esmeralda is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to buy materials to be able to make improvements to her home.  This will improve her family’s quality of life, most of all for her seven year old daughter.  This way she will keep struggling to make her big dream come true.  Her big dream is to give her daughter a profession.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata, 47, is a married woman with five children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Liberata has a coconut juice vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

Liberata requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconut juice to sell.

In the future, Liberata would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut juice to sell.

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en:
Kishwer has successfully built her beauty parlor, where she offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hairstyling and facials. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes enough to meet her household expenditures. 

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she purchased various beauty products. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 60,000 Pakistani rupees to buy hair rollers, makeup kits, whitening creams and lotions in large quantities. 

Kishwer is in her seventh loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings by serving more repeat customers.

loans.use: to buy hair rollers, makeup kits, whitening creams and lotions

loans.name: Humera

texts.en:
Humera is a 34-year-old divorced woman. She has been selling cloth for many years. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people in her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 55,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits to support her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Khalida’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to pay for the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Khalida has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Khalida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad, age 32, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market, at higher prices. She makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family income. 

Irshad needs to improve her business in order to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another calf. 

Irshad is in her third loan cycle, with good credit history. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She and her husband (the man shown in the picture) work in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. They supply construction materials such as baans and timber, earning sufficient income to meet their family expenses. 

In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Hanifa has contacted Kashf Foundation.  She has applied for her third loan of 40,000 PKR for the growth of their business. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. 

Hanifa is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to their business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar, age 61, is from the small village of Shukhuti. He is married and lives with four grown sons, his wife and sister. The family runs a small-scale agricultural business and breeds two milk cows and several beehives with bee colonies. Otar takes food to his livestock, and his wife produces dairy products for selling and for family consumption as well. 

Otar works hard, but his earnings from the agricultural business are modest, especially now when grazing season in fields is finished and the family receives a small amount of milk from the cows. 

Otar is seeking a job but his attempts are unsuccessful as he doesn’t have education or any kind of profession. That is why he decided to purchase a car and start a taxi business. He has experience in driving and hopes his business will generate income. He wishes to provide his family members with better living conditions and give them what they need. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 34-year-old married woman who has a business selling milk. She has two buffaloes and one cow, which she uses for milk that she sells to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Razia has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Razia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 40-year-old married woman. She has had a beauty parlor business for 10 years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hairstyling and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street. 

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a variety of cosmetics for the parlor. But because of having low amounts of cash on hand, she has applied for her ninth loan with the Kashf Foundation. 

She has requested a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees to buy large quantities of haircare products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening. She is hoping to serve more repeat customers. She expects to boost her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of haircare products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Jeniffer Patricia

texts.es: Jennifer tiene 20 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León. Una joven soltera y estudiante en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Su mayor sueño es tener su título de licenciatura y ser el orgullo de sus padres. Sus papas la ayudan en lo que pueden económicamente para que sean una persona de bien y profesional. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar los gastos del curso de titulación, con el fin de culminar su carrera universitaria. Su plan futuro es poder graduarse obteniendo su título.
texts.en: Jennifer is 20 years old and from Leon.  She is a student at one of the universities in town and her greatest dream is to have a masters title and be the pride of her parents.  Her parents help her financially however they can so that she can become a professional someday.  She is asking for this loan to pay for her title so she can finish at university.  Her plan is to graduate.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 22 years old. She has one child, age 2. She sells various items in her business. With this loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business. She has been very successful with her previous loan, because she bought livestock with the profits after reinvesting some money in her existing business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar, and jugs for resale.

loans.name: Farhana

texts.en:
Farhana, age 46, earns her living by preparing and selling a traditional dish called tikka kebab. This is a dish consisting of pieces of chicken, beef, and lamb, which are grilled on a skewer. She is an expert in making good-tasting tikka kebab, and she has many regular customers. Her husband assists in the business by helping to sell her prepared food to members of the community. Farhana's business allows her to earn enough to contribute to the family income.

In order to increase her sales, Farhana needs to purchase a new skewer for preparing tikka kebab, as well as packs of oil and spices. For this purpose, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan in the amount of Rs. 60,000. She is in her eleventh loan cycle and has a good repayment history. 

She wishes to use the expected boost in her income to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new skewer for preparing tikka kebab, as well as packs of oil and spices

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia has successfully established her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes a good amount of income to support her household expenditures. 

Previously with the help of a Kiva loan, she purchased necessary items to stock her store. Currently, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to purchase a stock of grains, oil, and biscuits. This will help her to meet the demands of her customers. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of grains, oil, and biscuits.

loans.name: Caroline Sidonie

texts.fr: Caroline est une femme de 28 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle possède une stand de vente de vivres secs(oignons, arachides, riz, mais) et de crédit de communication dans un quartier de la ville depuis 05 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et de crédit de communication afin d'augmenter sa clientèle et son chiffre d'affaire.les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son capital (activité) et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, logement, santé).
texts.en: Caroline is a 28-year-old woman, unmarried, and the mother of one child. She has owned a stand for five years selling dry goods (onions, peanuts, corn) and also communication credits in a district in the city.  She is requesting a loan to bolster her stock of goods and communication credits to increase her customer base and her sales. The profits generated will be added back to her business capital and used to meet family needs (education, food, housing, healthcare).

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies and communication credits

loans.name: Nelva Patricia

texts.es: Nelva tiene 23 años es soltera ella se dedica a dictar de matemática – física en un centro educativo. Ella  se siente muy satisfecha de poder ejercer su profesión que estudio por vocación. Ella tiene como motivación el ver que sus alumnos aprender y ponen empeño en aprender todo lo que les trasmite en sus clases. Actualmente tiene como fin estudiar la maestría. El préstamo lo invertirá en las pensiones de la maestría que iniciara. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado.
texts.en: Nelva is 23 years old. She is single and works teaching physics- mathematics at an educational center. She feels very satisfied being able to practice her profession that she studied as a vocation. Her motivation is seeing her students learn and strive to learn everything that is taught to them in their classes. Right now, her goal is to study for her master's. She will invest the loan in paying for tuition for her master's that she will begin soon. She is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition to get her master's .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Josiane

texts.fr: Josiane est une femme de 28 ans, marié et mère de 4 enfants. elle vend des vivres frais et secs dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant 4 sacs d'arachide afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans l'activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Josiane is a 28 year old woman who is married with four children. She has been selling fresh and dried food in a quarter of the town for seven years. She requests a loan in order to increase her stock of merchandise by buying four sacks of ground nuts, hoping to satisfy the demand of her clientele and increase her turnover. The profits generated will be reinvested in her business and will provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Amour  D Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mukosa est une vaillante commerçante depuis 20 ans, âgée de 62 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui sont tous mariés. La cliente est présidente et membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Amour D». Elle est vendeuse des huiles et sociétaire d’un dépôt. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un quartier animé de la place. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 2500litres d’huile. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  accroitre son capital, contibuer à la scolarisation de ses petits fils et assurer leurs soins médicaux. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de  post conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Mukosa is a client who has been a plucky shopkeeper for 20 years. She is 62 and has seven children all of whom are married. This client is a member and president of the «Amour D» business association. She sells oil and is part of a group that has a warehouse. She sets up her merchandise in a busy quarter of the town. She requests a loan from Hekima to expand her activity. She plans to buy 2,500 litres of oil. Her husband is also a storekeeper. She set up her business with money that her husband gave her. In the future, she hopes to increase her capital and contribute to the cost of sending her grandsons to school and their medical expenses. She thanks Hekima for their action in support of women in business who are not bankable, by granting them a loan during this difficult post-war period in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy 30 containers of oil.

loans.name: Daryikan

texts.ru: Дарыйкан 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Старшая дочь Гулмира-домохозяйка, вторая дочь Надира работает поваром, сын Жылдызбек-строитель, дочь Нурия тоже домохозяйка, самый младший сын Урмат-строитель. Супруг Дарыйкан фермер помогает по домашнему хозяйству. У Дарыйкан - среднее образование. Она счастливая мама пятерых детей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Дарыйкан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки дойной коровы на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Дарыйкан, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 нетель, 1 бычок, 1 овца, а также 1,60 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дарыйкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку семян картофеля элитного сорта. Доходы от кредита Дарыйкан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства в помощь сыну при покупке нового дома.
texts.en: Daryikan is 50 years old, married, and has five children with her spouse. Her eldest daughter Gulmira is a housewife, her second daughter Nadira is a cook, her son Zhyldyzbek is a construction worker, her daughter Nuria is also a housewife, and the youngest son Urmat is a construction worker. Daryikan's husband is a farmer and helps around the property. Daryikan has a high school education. She is the happy mother of five children. To provide the family's primary source of income she raises animals and crops. She started 14 years ago with the purchase of a milk cow for 20,000 som KGS. Thanks to her tireless work today she owns a milk cow, a heifer and a bull calf, a sheep, and also 1.6 hectares of land where she grows potatoes for the family and for sale. Her montly income is 11,000 som (KGS). In order to further expand her business Daryikan asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy high quality seed potatoes. She plans to invest income from the loan into expanding her livestock herd, and she also plans to save money to help her son buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy high quality seed potatoes

loans.name: Alba Merarda

texts.es: Alba Merarda, mayor de edad soltera con seis hijos todos independientes, originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable en sus momentos de saldar sus cuentas, ademas de eso es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa para niños, damas, caballeros, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos, electrodomésticos, utensilios de cosina, entre otros, el cual lo realiza de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación su jornada empiezas desde muy temprano sus compras son al contado, en mercados de mayores fuera del departamento, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales recupera semanal o quincenal lo invertido, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para reforzar su capital de trabajo como: pantalones, zapatos, cosméticos, utensilios de cosina entre otros y así completar algunos encargos que ella tiene a sus clientes, Alba agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Alba Merarda has six grown children.  She lives in the rural town of Chinandega in western Nicaragua.  She is known to be enterprising, hard-working and a responsible manager of her finances.  She makes a living selling all kinds of general merchandise: clothing, footwear, cosmetics, kitchen utensils, small appliances, etc.  She sells from both her house and, working as a street vendor, to passers-by in the town.  She starts her days very early, traveling to a wholesale marketing in another town where she pays cash for the merchandise she buys, then traveling back to sell the merchandise to her customers.  She extends credit to regular customers and takes cash from other buyers.  Alba Merarda will use this loan to stock her business with merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, kitchen utensils, etc. and she sends her thanks to Kiva investors for supporting her business and others like it.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es:
El Sr. Emanuel es de la ciudad de Santaní, es soltero y comenta que se dedica a ser vendedor ambulante de verduras y frutas, tiene un motocarro para el reparto de sus productos.
Tiene ya una clientela formada, que siempre le hace pedidos y que son clientes ya fijos de él. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio fijo, donde no tenga que viajar de manera ambulante.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras frescas para la venta, y por medio de esto poder seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Emanuel is from the city of Santaní.  He is single, and he says that he sells fruit and vegetables in an itinerant manner.  He has a ‘motocarro’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle] to deliver his products.  He has a customer base that always orders from him.  They are fixed customers of his.  His dream is to be able to have a fixed business, where he does not have to travel in an itinerant manner.

He is requesting this loan to be able to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to sell.  By doing this, he will be able to continue working and struggling to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Obeissance (1) Group

texts.en: Christine is one of the members of the group Obeissance (1). She is the leader of a group consisting of ten other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Christine owns a stall in the market where she sells salted fish, foufou, and other various items to her clients. Christine has been with HOPE Congo for two loan cycles and faces challenges relating to the frequent fluctuation in prices of the merchandise that she must buy. Christine has found that her business-savvy and the stock of her products allows her to be able to grow her business. Her goal is to move from the open market into her own small boutique and shop to be able to provide better service to her customers. With her increased revenue, she hopes to be able to send her children to a better school and to build a house for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her market stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for local workers.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Esperanza es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Caaguazú, está en el 3er ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 11  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, trabajando y luchando por mejorar su vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delsy, quien se dedica a las ventas de manera ambulante. Entre las cosas que ella vende están la venta de ropas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Delsy solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas variadas para las ventas,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Esperanza (Hope) group was formed in the city of Caaguazú.  It is in its third cycle with the communal bank where all of the women work and help each other to get ahead.  They are part of the Poverty Elimination Program; 11 of the members are below the poverty line, working and struggling to improve their lives.  One of the members is Delsy who makes a living as a street vendor.  She sells items of clothing among other things.  

The work of the advisers should also be emphasized.  They follow up constantly with trainings and checkups that are required but at the same time encourage the woman to fight to overcome poverty.

Delsy is requesting this loan for the purchase of a variety of clothing items to sell.  This will help her to solidify her business plan which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Jarkinay

texts.ru: Жаркынай 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Жаркынай - неоконченное-высшее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жаркынай занимается полеводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жаркынай, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2,30 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль для реализации. Урожай получает богатый, так как Жаркынай знает все тонкости выращивания фасоли. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаркынай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку семян фасоли для посевных работ. Доходы от кредита Жаркынай планирует вложить в развитие сельского хозяйства и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Jarkinay is 30 years old, married, and has three children with her spouse. She has an unfinished college education. As the primary source of income for her family she farms, as she has since she started 12 years ago with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work today she owns 2.3 hectares of land where each year she grows beans to sell. Her harvest is plentiful since she understands the finest details of bean farming. Her monthly income is 16,000 som (KGS).  Jarkinay came to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners to ask for a loan to buy bean seeds for planting, with the goal of further developing her business. She plans to invest earnings from the loan into farming, and also plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy  bean seeds

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 27 years old.  He lives in Gaza with his wife.  He has been married recently. 

In 2011, Mohammad opened his repair phones shop.  He has good experience in this work.   He needs this youth loan in order to buy a display box and shelves.  This will arrange his work better, and also give his customers a good view.  He hopes to improve his business also increase his income.  His dream is to insure good financial conditions for his family in the future .  

Mohammad wants to thank everyone who helps him to achieve success.  He believes that this loan will improve his work a lot.

loans.use: buy a display box and shelves

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 39-year-old, sari-sari store owner, from Cortes, Bohol. She is a married woman with three children, ages 5, 12, and 18. 

Rita sells basic household commodities needed by her neighbors, like seasoning, chips, milk, coffee, and toiletries. She is asking for a loan to buy canned sardines, corned beef, beef loaf, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and seasoning, which are bought by her neighbors on a daily basis. 

In the future, Rita wants to make improvements and expand her store, to gain a greater profit. Any income will be used for the family's daily consumption, savings, school fees, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, corned beef, beef loaf, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza works hard to support her family. Liza is married and has an electric fan repair shop business in the Philippines.

Liza requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.  Liza has been in this business for 2 years now.

Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 56 years old and widowed with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   Lolita has a rope making business in the Philippines. 

Lolita requested a PHP 27000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials to be use for her business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been in this business for 8 years. Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy rope making materials

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, 45, is a married woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lilia has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell such as biscuits, spices, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc.

Lilia has been in this business for ten years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell such as biscuits, spices, detergent soap, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is taxi driver from Vanadzor town. He lives with his family, which consists of his wife and two sons (20 and 5 years old).

Arayik is a very attentive and professional driver and his clients value the service very much. Unfortunately the car that Arayik drives as a taxi is damaged and he isn't able renovate it. He is now asking this loan to be able to purchase new tires and renovate the car. This will greatly assist Arayik to continue taxi driving. 

Arayik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is important for this hard working man who does his best to sustain his family’s living.

loans.use: buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is from Spitak town, where he lives together with his wife. The couple has been involved in a retail business for already 3 years. Particularly they bring clothing from Yerevan and sell it to locals in Spitak town. As there are not many shops from where people can go and buy the clothing they want, Gegham and his wife decided to provide people with those opportunities.

For purchasing new stock of clothing, Gegham and his wife have no financial means. So, Gegham decided to apply for this loan to purchase new stock of clothing and resell it to his customers during the holidays.

Gegham has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is important for Gegham and his wife to continue successfully run their retail business and increase the turnover.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, spices, rice, pork, chicken, etc. for her food vending business.  Lolita has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita earns an income through her handicraft business. She is shown here with some of the products she makes and sells. She has been engaged in her crafts business for the past 30 years and works hard to support her family.

Lolita is requesting a PhP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more materials for her business.

Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luema

texts.en:
Luema is 30 years old and married, with four children. With her four children in school, Luema works very hard to provide for them.

Luema runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items, like toothpaste, sanitary napkins, sugar, coffee, vinegar, and other groceries to sell.

Luema has been in this business for 12 years and she sells a variety of items, such as toothpaste, sanitary napkins, sugar, coffee, vinegar, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, like toothpaste, sanitary napkins, sugar, coffee, vinegar, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala is from Vanadzor town. She has been involved in a retail business for 20 years. Specifically, Lala sells flowers in one of the local rented stores.  

Due to a kind attitude toward people, Lala's store is well known among locals. She lives with her two children and mother. Now she has applied for this loan for financial support. She needs that support to be able to purchase flowers for reselling to customers. 

Lala has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for this hard-working woman to be able to increase her turnover and gather more income.

loans.use: buy flowers to resell

loans.name: Mushpig

texts.en:
Mushpig, 41, is a married man who lives in Jandara, in the Gardabani district of Georgia. He has a wife, a son and his mother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. His wife is a housekeeper. 

To take care of his family's everyday needs, Mushpig is engaged in buying and selling vehicles. He goes to Foti, in West Georgia, purchases cars at low prices and sells them in East Georgia at a good price. From this activity, he generates approximately 500 Georgia lari (GEL) per month. 

As it becomes harder to make a living from this income only, Mushpig has decided to start an agribusiness. This start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program for 4,000 GEL to purchase milk cows.  

After the cows are purchased, the family will start producing dairy products -- cheese and yogurt -- to sell. They will also use the milk products to feed the family. 

This new business initiative will give Mushpig a chance to have financial stability and grow his monthly income.

loans.use: to buy milk cows and start an agribusiness

loans.name: Tarieli

texts.en:
Tarieli is a 44-year-old married man who lives in Samtredia, West Georgia. He lives with wife and a little son. Tarieli's wife is a cleaner in a restaurant and gets 200 GEL monthly. Tarieli works as a driver for road construction.  He has several private orders during the month.  Approximately his income consists 300 GEL per month. However, this income is hardly enough for the family, considering the fact that Tarieli can generate more if he has a vehicle and works  as taxi driver everyday, in parallel to his present activities. 

Tarieli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that helps rural people to start or restart businesses. This loan is very important for Tarieli to be able to start providing taxi service and gain more income for his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: buy a car to start a taxi business

loans.name: Mullohoja

texts.ru:
Муллоходжа мужчина  в возрасте 43 лет, женат имеет 3 детей. Муллоходжа занимается перевозкой грузов. Его рейс начинается рано утром на рынке стройматериалов. Жена сидит дома воспитывает детей. Раньше он занимался розничной торговлей дров и угля . Вскоре он приобрел старую машину и начал предоставлять транспортные услуги. 
Он хорошо известен среди своих клиентов как надежный и опытный водитель. 
Муллоходжа запрашивает кредит, чтобы приобрести небольшой "Портер" грузовик, который потребляет меньше топлива, чем другие грузовики, чтобы начать предоставлять качественно- транспортные услуги.  Его машина уже устарела и он хочет, на приобретенный кредит купить автомашину.
texts.en:
Mullohoja is a man of the age of 43. He is married and has three children. Mullohoja works with transporting cargo. His trip starts early in the morning at the market for building materials. His wife stays at home to raise the children. 

Earlier, Mullohoja worked with retail sales of firewood and coal. Soon he purchased an old vehicle and started providing a transportation service. He is well-known among his customers as a reliable and experienced driver. 

Mullohoja requests a loan to purchase a small "Porter" truck, which needs less fuel than the other trucks, in order to start providing a high quality transportation service. His vehicle is already old and he would like to buy a vehicle for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a truck

loans.name: Fiqirete

texts.en: Fiqirete is back wanting your financial help again, yet this time to make home repairs. Kindly note that she is very grateful to all lenders and wishes them Happy Holidays:)

loans.use: to make minor repairs to the family home to accomodate her sick child

loans.name: Mehry

texts.ru:
Мехри, женщина в возрасте 51 года, живет в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского района. Она замужем имеет троих детей. Её дети уже взрослые.Мехри дружно живет со своей семей.  Она чистосердечная, добрая и старательная  женщина, еще с детство она занимается откармливанием и размножением крупно-рогатого скота. Она имеет дойную корову, которая каждый день дает по 10 л. молоко и она продает соседям и знакомым.  Также у нее  имеется телята которых она откармливает и продает  мясникам. Ее муж Жаббор работает плотником в частных стройках.
Мехри   говорит, что доход от этой вид деятельности стабильный, но низкий, поэтому она хочет увеличить количество коров, чтобы увеличит доходность этого бизнеса. Она очень надеется, что  "Арванд"  поддержит ее финансово.
texts.en:
Mehry is a woman of the age of 51 years. She lives in a village in the J. Rasulov region. She is married and has three children. Her children are already adults. Mehry lives happily with his family. She is a wholehearted, good and industrious woman. 

Since childhood, Mehry has worked with fattening and breeding cattle. She has a dairy cow, which gives around 10 liters of milk every day, and she sells this to neighbors and friends. She also has calves which she fattens and sells to the butcher. Her husband, Zhabbor, works as a carpenter in a private building company. Mehry tells us that the income from that type of activity is stable, but small. Therefore, she would like to increase the number of cows so that she can increase the income from this business. She hopes very much that Arvand will support her financially.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 31 years old and is from Batumi city.  She is married and has one infant child. It is nearly a month since Nino and her husband has been running a  bakery together. Nino bakes various pies and makes sandwiches and her husband works as a salesperson. The business is going well but it needs support for developing.
 
In order to generate more income and expand her business, Nino is requesting a small-sized loan. With the received amount, she will buy raw materials and bake more pies. She will offer a wider assortment of products to her customers and increase turnover.

Nino and her family hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: invest in her bakery

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 51-year-old, married woman, doing business selling milk for the past 20 years. She has two buffaloes in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life.
 
Suriya has three children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 
 
It’s Suriya's fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business, through the support of it. Now, Suriya requests a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad, age 41 and married, earns an income by operating a small general store in her community. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She earns enough from her business to provide for her family. 

In order to keep her store fully stocked, she has requested a loan in the amount of Rs 50,000, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. This will allow her to meet increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her expected boost in revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Khairiddin

texts.ru: Хайриддин начинающий бизнесмен. Он живет в районе Фархор. Хайриддин коммуникативный, деятельный и активный молодой человек. Ему 27 лет. Он женат и у него дочь в возрасте 3 лет и сын в возрасте 1,5 лет. Хайриддин певец. Он зарабатывает тем, что поёт на свадьбах. В зимний период у него совсем мало заказов. Жители его района предпочитают проводить свадебные мероприятия в теплый сезон. Поэтому он сейчас остался совсем без источника дохода. Так как его брат занимается животноводством - куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота, Хайриддин последние месяцы работал вместе с ним и научился этому ремеслу. Теперь когда он изучил все нюансы этого бизнеса, он решил открыть собственный бизнес по откорму и продаже скота. Начальный капитал Хайриддина составляет 400 долларов и при дворе своего дома он уже построил коровник. Хайриддин просит в кредит еще 2100 долларов США. Он планирует купить 4 голов крупнорогатого скота и 240 килограмм корма для скота. Он уже сейчас верит, что его бизнес будет успешным.
texts.en: Khairiddin is a beginning businessman. He lives in the Farkhor district. Khairiddin is a communicative, active, and energetic young man. He is 27 years old, married, and has a three year old daughter and 1.5 year old son. Khairiddin is a singer and makes a living singing at weddings. In winter he has few bookings since people in his region prefer to celebrate weddings in the warm season. This leaves him completely without a source of income. Since his brother raises livestock - specifically the buying and selling of cattle, Khairiddin has worked the past few months with him and has learned the trade. Now that he has learned all the nuances of the business he has decided to start his own business raising and selling livestock. Khairiddin has 400 USD in starting capital, and has already built a small barn near his house. He is asking for another 2100 USD as a loan. He plans to buy 4 head of cattle and 240 kilograms of livestock feed. He already believes that his business will be successful.

loans.use: To buy four head of cattle and 240 kilograms of animal feed.

loans.name: Casa De Jesus Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Casa de Jesus”, meaning “House of Jesus,” consists of ten hard-working women who live in the area of Zunil, Quetzaltenango. This area of Guatemala is in the highlands and can be very cold. It is an agricultural area and some of the best vegetables of the country are grown here. “Casa de Jesus” was formed just eight months ago, and the ladies are applying for their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. They intend to use the funds in their small businesses which include the sale of food (chicken, fruits, and vegetables) as well as everyday items including clothing and shoes.

Antonia is a 33-year-old mother of three children who is married to a bricklayer. She sells food including tortillas, fried chicken, and French fries! Her two young daughters are 10 and 12 years of age and although they attend school for part of the day, they help their mother after completing their homework. Antonia’s first loan helped her expand her business and now she wants to expand even more, and so she is applying for a second loan. She will use the funds to purchase additional materials for food production including gas to fry chicken and to make French fries. She wants to diversify her daily menu and will have to buy additional ingredients. Finally, Antonia plans to purchase more corn to produce more tortillas, which are usually made three times each day in Guatemala.

This hard-working woman shares with us that she returned to school and that this year, she is in the 4th grade. She firmly believes that it is never too late to learn and attend school on Sundays. Antonia dreams of completing primary school and then will evaluate her next step, which might be to move onward to the next level. However, her children are her first priority and she wants to see them attend college. For this reason, she will work diligently at her business, keeping her goals in mind.

All of the women of the Trust Bank's “Casa de Jesus” wish to express their appreciation for the opportunity to secure loans through Friendship Bridge. Without this vital capital, they would be unable to maintain and/or grow their businesses. They look forward to a better standard of living and a brighter future for themselves, their families, and their community of Zunil!

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for food production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two pigs at 240 pounds each.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 50 years old. She is married and has two children. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale to use in rendering services as a Community Knowledge Worker.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Ogechi

texts.fr: Mariée à un revendeur et mère de 02 enfants de 08 et 05ans scolarisés,madame Ogechi quant à elle s'est aussi lancée dans l'activité de vente d'habits. Elle exerce son activité au marché et achète au même lieu. N’arrivant pas à satisfaire les clients à cause du manque de marchandises, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à agrandir son activité et assurer les moindres besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Married to a retailer, Ms. Ogechi is a mother of two children, aged 8 and 5 years old. As for herself, she also got started in the business of selling clothing. She operates at the market and makes her purchases at the same location. Not able to satisfy her customers due to a lack of merchandise, she is requesting an initial loan to purchase some. The profit will help her to expand her business and ensure the basic needs of her family are met.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a rice farmer from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of two school-aged children. She started farming eight years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and to pay for labor. Helen knows that the success of farming is also attributed to fertilizer and the loan will be a great help to make her farming a success.

Her income provides food and pays school fees for her children. In the future, Helen hopes to have another business to maximize her income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
For 11 years now, Salome has been engaging in hog raising business. She enjoys doing this livelihood because it allows her to stay at home and look after her school-aged children. Salome is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and feed to keep the hogs healthy. With availability of feed, she can focus on looking after her animals without having to worry about the finances for hogs.
